entry.title: Re: Moniter Material Coverage_Suppier
entry.content:
Dear @ISoma,

In Monitor Material Coverage app the Supplier Name / Supplier Number columns are populated only when the system can determine or already has a source of supply for the material/plant

A supplier is shown when at least one of the following is true:

1. A procurement element already exists with a supplier

  • For example: a purchase order, scheduling agreement schedule line or a purchase requisition that already has a source assigned vendor/outline agreement

2. MRP source determination can select a valid source of supply
During the planning run, the system searches for a valid source in this order:

  • Quota arrangement including source list entries with MRP indicator
  • Source list with MRP indicator
  • Scheduling agreement
  • Purchasing contract
  • Purchasing info record with automatic sourcing indicator

If none of these yields a valid source validity dates, not blocked, applicable org/plant, etc.), the supplier fields remain blank

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3531581

If multiple Purchasing Info Records exist, will they all be displayed?

No, the app will not list all possible suppliers/info records for a row. It shows the one source that MRP selected/assigned for that material/plant

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Contingent Worker/External to Employee Conversions through Onboarding
entry.content: We have a terrible process to handle contingent worker to employee conversions.  We track our contingent workers in EC through Work Orders.  The contingent applies to a job through the external career site (because they are not employees) and if offered the job, the recruiter initiates onboarding.  Typically, they come up in rehire validation/employment selection profile.  The onboarding admin does not accept the match and selects to proceed as new hire.  Now there are two records for this person.  The onboardee completes their onboarding tasks.  The onboarding admin downloads all of the documents, takes a print screen of the new hire validation/personal information data, cancels the onboarding and rehires them in using the Add New Employee.  When the rehire validation comes up, the admin selects rehire with new employment and then the records are combined.  The issue is the onboarding record leaves a cancelled record that needs to be purged.  If the onboarding admin forgets to remove the national ID, they cannot use the add new employee functionality and the purge becomes urgent.  With 1H 2025, SAP introduced the Legal Entity transfer.  We thought this would work for us, but because the contingent  worker applies on the external site to go through initiate onboarding so they can complete their compliance tasks.  They do not receive the Legal Entity Transfer Welcome Mail and cannot toggle between profiles because they did not apply internally.  Are any other customers having this issue.  Is the way you solved for it to allow CWs to apply through internal career site and if so, how do you assign the I-9 and other compliance tasks?  Any assistance is appreciated.

00;00;00;25 - 00;00;06;20

This is the SAP Developer News for January 22nd, 2026.

00;00;06;23 - 00;00;09;18

Hyderabad. We have two more CodeJams on SAP Gen AI and ABAP Cloud. Do let us know in which city you want to have the next CodeJam. And I'll just have one more news to share. UI5Con is coming to Bangalore after many years. So all UI5 enthusiast

00;00;44;21 - 00;01;15;26

The first monthly customer and partner roundtable for SAP BTP Platform Automation is set to take place next month. Tuesday, the 10th of February at 1100 hours CET. BTP Platform automation. That's right. Topics such as the BTP CLI and Terraform. Two of my favorite topics during the session. There'll be Q&A. There'll be a round of updates, some demos and also a look ahead for the rest of 2026.

00;01;15;28 - 00;01;28;20

Everyone's welcome. You just need to register. It's free. Christian's blog post has all the details, so head over there and check it out. Link in the description.

00;01;28;22 - 00;01;58;22

Hola developers! Are you using the event mesh capability and you also use cloud them for monitoring? Well, here's some news for you. It is now possible to monitor the event mesh capability directly in SAP cloud ALM, meaning that you can now not just monitor your cloud integration tenant, but also your event mesh capability program for the broker. You can monitor the broker health active connections, message consumers and message queues.

00;01;58;25 - 00;02;18;20

The setup is pretty straightforward. If your integration suite is already in cloud ALM, then you just hit the scope selector in the health monitoring app, toggle on the event Mesh capability and that's it. Want to learn more about it? Check out Shivani’s blog post on SAP community. Hasta luego.

00;02;18;22 - 00;02;44;23

Developers love road maps, particularly when we're not the ones that have to deliver on them. They're kind of like wish lists that are going to be fulfilled. This month we see the updated SAPUI5 road map and contains lots of new functionality around Fiori web components and other capabilities that SAPUI5 makes possible.

This year, it includes three classic one day conferences. UI5Con on Tuesday, reCAP on Wednesday and HANA TechCon on Thursday, and starting the CodeConnect week off on Monday. I'm not one, not two, but three CodeJams one on CAP topics, one on Gen AI coding on the SAP rapid one model and one on UI5.

00;04;05;23 - 00;04;35;03

When is CodeConnect, I hear you ask? Well, it's pretty much right in the center of July. It's most of the week beginning the 13th of July. It's been in St. Leon/ROT in Germany as usual at the SAP campus. There we can mingle and chat with like minded developers, listen to and maybe even give sessions and just generally geek out. Meeting the advocates. Yeah. Especially that. And also with AI, the big buzzwords, seeing what is a piece doing with it? entry.title: Re: How to perform Quarterly consolidations in SAP S/4HAN...
entry.content:
Hi,

Step 1:Set the consolidation frequency as Quarterly for the desired group. 

Step 2:Execute (on demand or schedule)  Data monitor task monthly for e.g., period 1-3.

Step3:Execute consolidation monitor tasks quarterly, for e.g., period 3, 6, 9, 12.
